result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Durrant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber for going to work or going to school.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $150 plus costs.  
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain fulltime employment or school or combination of both for fulltime.
No abusive contact with Amber Vechinski.

Partciipate in any counseling as recommended by the agent. 
If successfully completes these conditions and the agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from DOC dated 09/01/16 in re:  imposing DNA Surcharge
Regarding DOC Correspondence /s/ RJS 09/07/16
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Adam M Durrant in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:37 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant agrees with previous convictions. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

State provides the Court with a written victim witness statement.
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 150 days in jail with huber for going to work or going to school.  STAYED
Placed on probation for 24 months concurrent with any other probation he is current on
Pay fine of $150 plus costs.
Maintain fulltime employment or school or combination of both for fulltime. 
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent. 
No abusive contact with Amber Vechinski.
If successfully completes these conditions and the agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Ryan W. Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drengler states his client will be late today about 15 mins.  Court set matter aside to deal with later.
Court calls case at 3:59 p.m.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
Atty Drengler request bond modification to allow contact with Victim.
BTC:  Denied until the Victim contacts the DA office to state if she wants contact.  Then bond will be amended by stipulation from DA office to allow no abusive contact.

ADA states to the Atty Drengler that the Defendant is not to be the one to tell her she would have to contact the DA office.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adam M Durrant in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam M Durrant
Current: 8879 County Road BB, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2014)
Prior: W13332 Cth C, Hancock, WI 54943
Initial appearance on July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam M Durrant in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has an attorney from Wausau, but will need to contact the Public Defender.
Matter rescheduled to allow time to get an attorney.
Bond continued.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam M Durrant in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews the file.  Notes Atty Ulrich has not filed a Notice of Retainer. 
Defendant indicates he has retained him and he filed a Notice.  That was last week Thursday. 

Court will continue for 2 weeks to allow for attorney to be present to schedule the preliminary hearing as well.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Comply with restrainging order conditions.
No contact with Amber Vechinski.

Defendant Adam M Durrant in court. Veronica Isherwood with Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant indicates he has not had a chance to consult with his attorney, Ryan Ulrick out of Oshkosh. 

Court will adjourn to allow for counsel. 

Intern Kraus recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
